versos: (musician) 1 Chronicles 25:1 - "Moreover, David and the commanders of the army set apart for the service the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who prophesied with lyres, with harps, and with cymbals.";;;
(neginoth) Psalm 61:1 - "To the chief Musician upon Neginah, A Psalm of David.";;;
(throat) Psalm 5:9 - "For there is no truth in their mouth; their inmost self is destruction; their throat is an open grave; they flatter with their tongue.";;;
(bent) Psalm 146:8 - "The Lord lifts up those who are bowed down; the Lord loves the righteous.";;;
(babes) 1 Peter 2:2 - "As newborn babes, desire the pure milk of the word, that you may grow thereby.";;;
(crowned) 1 Corinthians 9:25 - "Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last, but we do it to get a crown that will last forever.";;;
(covetous) Hebrews 13:5 - "Keep your lives free from the love of money and be content with what you have, because God has said, 'Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you.'";;;
(den) Genesis 37:24 - "They took him and threw him into the cistern. The cistern was empty; there was no water in it.";;;
(bend) Isaiah 45:23 - "By myself I have sworn; from my mouth has gone out in righteousness a word that shall not return: 'To me every knee shall bow, every tongue shall swear allegiance.'";;;
(shekel) Ezekiel 45:12 - The shekel shall be twenty gerahs; twenty shekels, twenty-five shekels, fifteen shekels, shall be your mina.;;;
(ceaseth) "And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these is charity." - 1 Corinthians 13:13;;;
(geshur) 2 Samuel 3:3 - "His second son was Kileab the son of Abigail the widow of Nabal of Carmel; the third, Absalom the son of Maacah daughter of Talmai king of geshur.";;;
(adonijah) 1 Kings 1:5 - Now adonijah, whose mother was Haggith, put himself forward and said, "I will be king." So he got chariots and horses ready, with fifty men to run ahead of him.;;;
(michtam) Psalm 16: Title: A Miktam of David.;;;
(greedy) Luke 12:15 - "Then he said, 'Beware Guard against every kind of greed. Life is not measured by how much you own.'";;;
(highest) Psalm 92:1 - "It is good to give thanks to the Lord, to sing praises to your name, O Most High;";;;
(simple) Proverbs 14:15 - "The simple believe anything, but the prudent give thought to their steps.";;;
